Boston.com
10

I-93 shooting investigated

State police say a man was shot in the arm in his car on Interstate 93 in the Braintree-Randolph area by a person who fired a gun from another vehicle. (AP, 11:54 a.m.)

Congress: Explain Benghazi comments

Congress has ordered the Obama administration to explain who exactly created its "talking points" on the attack, and who omitted the CIA's early conclusion that terrorists were involved. (AP, 10:39 a.m.)
  • Dozen House women defend Rice on Libya | Discuss
Colts vs. Patriots: 4:25 p.m. | Pictures

Going back a dozen years or so, there have many memorable games between these two teams, both regular season and playoffs. Take a look back.

Trouble follows Talib

Aqib Talib is hoping to restart his career in New England while distancing himself from past legal problems. (Boston Globe)
  • 11/15 Talib addresses Patriots media

Beverly man dies in Maine plane crash

The University of Maine says three fraternity brothers, including a 22-year-old student from Beverly, were killed when their plane burst into flames. (AP)

Safety chief has long list of violations

Sheila Burgess, director of the Massachusetts Highway Safety Division, has more than 30 entries on her driving record dating back to the early 1980s, and is on leave from an accident this past August. (Globe)
